result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E Ostrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald E Ostrowski
Current: 1745 LaCrestent St, #31, La Crosse, WI 54603 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2017)
Prior: 1745 LaCrestent St, Millston, WI 54643 United States

9:30 a.m. Defendant Ronald E Ostrowski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State amends Count 1 on the record to remove the Repeater modifier.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: Amended Count 1: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification by the State. Victim not present today.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
ADA Hess makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:**
$50 fine + costs + surcharges = $516
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Gerald Ostrowski during the pendency of this action

1:20 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  February 22, 2016 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
